fields.description:
See CONF-19331 and http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Copy+of+Configuring+Daily+Backups

The instructions are:
{noformat}
   1.  Edit the confluence.cfg.xml file found in the Confluence Home directory.
   2. Set the value of property admin.ui.allow.daily.backup.custom.location to 'true' (without the quotation marks).
   3. Restart Confluence.


{noformat}

However, the *confluence-init.properties* file contains some new text:

{noformat}###########################
# Daily Backups Directory #
###########################

## Set this to true to enable setting of the daily backups directory in the admin section.
#confluence.backup.path.set.allowed=false {noformat}


As far as I can tell, this setting has no affect on the system behaviour, and is presumably in here by mistake. 

This is potentially confusing for admin users, and certainly gives a bad impression of the product.
fields.summary: Daily Backups setting is provided in the wrong configuration file

fields.description: CONF-11416 has been implemented in 3.3. We need to setup the docs.atlassian.com redirects before we release.
fields.summary: Setup docs.atlassian.com redirects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19479].
  {panel}

We have a number of customers that ask via sales or support about performance bench marks. 

Questions like:

How many pages/spaces/attachments/concurrent users etc can confluence handle?
What are the expected times for page loads? 

What hardware to use?

Of course these factors vary widely from instance to instance, depending on size/usage/plugins involved etc. 

However it would greatly help support to be able to point customers to some bench marks.
fields.summary: Define Performance Bench Marks for users
Typo in text shown after creating a site backup

fields.description:
* Install a fresh instance of Confluence
* Enter a licence key, and click on "Custom Installation"

The 'External Database' text has the following typos:
* "estabilished"
* "if you already have an established, supported database of choice within your organisation it advisable to use this database."
fields.summary: Spelling error in text when configuring database

fields.description:
Same behaviour as CONF-5243 but in Confluence 3.1.2:
bq. When you move a page (with descendents) to the part of a hierarchy in another space, the ancestors table is not correctly updated, which leads to the corruption of the hierarchy data throughout the app (at least until the ancestors table is rebuilt.)

Unfortunately this is not easily replicate-able and affects only certain instances.

If the page you are trying to move has this problem and it has an attachment, page move will fail with FileNotFound not found exception. See [relevant KB article|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Move+Pages+with+Attachments].
{noformat}
2010-03-29 20:52:08,066  ERROR [http-8310-1] [pages.persistence.dao.UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener] moveAttachments Could not move the attachment data along with the page for move of page Solaris Tomcat install
 -- referer: http://localhost:8310/display/IT/Solaris+Tomcat+install | url: /pages/movepage.action | userName: confadm | action: movepage
java.io.FileNotFoundException: Source 'C:\confluence\confluence-home\attachments\ver003\27\117\1867777\67\243\5243067' does not exist
    at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.moveDirectory(FileUtils.java:1733)5243067
{noformat}

If you encounter this issue, please contact [support|http://support.atlassian.com] and submit your space XML backup to allow us analyse the data.
fields.summary: Ancestor table gets out of sync when moving pages to another space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19475].
  {panel}

I just tried to use the API as described over here. http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/3.2/

I was mainly interested in getting the children of a page. There is a long paragraph about expansion, which does not explain how it works all too well. I does warn about a possible confusion with other expand parameters, which is funny because it could easily just give a proper example instead. I was trying http://confluence.atlassian.com/rest/prototype/1/content/135922?expand=children, but i assume i ran into the wrong paramter here...?

To make things even more confusing, we're labelling our javascripty links for hiding and showing details "expand" too. 

Hopefully a job of just 5 minutes to clarify this bit of the docs by providing some proper examples.
fields.summary: Our REST documentation does a poor job at explaining expansion

fields.description:
Create a backup and download once, this will give you a zip file.
Subsequent downloads are uncompressed folders
fields.summary: Safari backup download is not an xml.zip file but an uncompressed folder

fields.description:
When displaying a page in Confluence, there are fixed areas taken up at the top and bottom of the window, which much reduce the available screen space for the text that one is attempting to read.  In the window dimensions that I normally use, the fixed material takes up 1 and 1/2 inch of the 6 inches of available vertical height, 25% waste.

This behavior reduces readability.  It is particularly annoying because the reader (me) knows that the information at the top and the bottom of a normally formatted web page can be easily accessed with various navigation aids (often simply the "Home" and "End" keys), and so the screen space is occupied to no good effect.
fields.summary: Confluence page display has much fixed matter at top and bottom of window
Create new stock user profile images / avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19471].
  {panel}

User profiles are a great way to _meet_ people within your company, especially if they work in on a completely different continent than you. The problem is, the 50x50 pixel image that confluence gives me is often not enough to see what someone really looks like. It would be great if there were a way to get a full-size view of someone's profile picture.

It could implemented very simply by adding a new option called "profile picture" to the hover profile dropdown. When someone selects this option, it would open the full image in gallery-style view.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100428-ck2t15xpjabp4fmx7yc53emw37.jpg!

!http://img.skitch.com/20100428-qarmrbcmb9agccq1cm32nprihg.jpg!
fields.summary: ability to get full view of a user's profile picture

fields.description: When the space is exported to HTML its appearance does not equal the appearance of the Wiki. For example the HEADINGs in the HTML are not grey as there are when display in the Wiki.
fields.summary: Exported HTML does not retain style of Wiki

fields.description:
This is totally annoying and took me a while to realise. The German hints are so long that they make the editor wider, but since we prohibit a horizontal scrollbar, the right part of the editor becomes inaccessible.

Fortunately the fix is really easy. Shorten the German hints! 

Assigning to 3.2.2. because it is trivial to fix, but for an average user it makes the editor unusable every now and then
fields.summary: German hints on Easy Reader can make last part of editor inaccessible
Unknown macro: {snippet} in some documentation

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Change system locale to Turkish
# Go to {{Dashboard -> Administration -> View Global Permissions}}
# Edit Permissions

You will get a System Error page with something like this
{code}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'canSetPermissionOnGroup' in class com.atlassian.confluence.security.actions.EditGlobalPermissionsAction threw exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unknown global permission: profileattachments at /admin/permissions/editglobalperms.vm[line 53, column 52]
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337)

caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unknown global permission: profileattachments
    at com.atlassian.confluence.security.administrators.EditGlobalPermissionsAdministrator.canSetPermissionOnGroup(EditGlobalPermissionsAdministrator.java:100)
{code}

\\
h5. Findings
|| Confluence Version || Remark ||
| 3.1, 3.1.1, 3.1.2, 3.2 | Tested and affected |
| 2.10.4, 3.0.0_01, 3.0.1, 3.0.2 | Unable to test due to [CONF-17160] |

\\
h5. Workaround
Cited from [CONF-7168|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-7168?focusedCommentId=67700&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_67700]
{quote}
As a work-around, please pass these arguments to your JVM by adding them to JAVA_OPTS in setenv.bat: -Duser.country=EN -Duser.language=en
{quote}
fields.summary: Turkish locale causing System Error when Global Permission is edited
Office Connector and SSO Supportability

fields.description:
When editing in Wiki Markup, addition of a space character (' ') will not be highlighted.

In page differences, we are supposed to see a green highlight.

In contrast, when editing in Rich Text Editor addition of a space character is highlighted just fine.

Steps to replicate the problem:
# Edit a page using wiki markup editor
# Go to the end of the line
# Type a space character
# Save
# The change won't be shown in page diff
fields.summary: When editing in Wiki Markup, addition of a space will not be highlighted

fields.description:
The jiraissues macro has inconsistent behavior with regards to the aggregate time tracking fields.

Steps to replicate:
# Create a worklog for a jira issue, a subtask, and an issue without a subtask.
# Add a filter for this, and add the aggregate fields to the issue navigator.
# Notice that the time tracking shows (screenshot 1)
# Add the following jiraissues macro (with aggregate field):
{jiraissues:url=http://localhost:8081/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/10000/SearchRequest-10000.xml?tempMax=1000\|columns=key,summary,aggregatetimeremainingestimate}
# Notice that the aggregate time only shows for the issue with the subtask, not the issue without subtask or the sub-task itself.

The JIRA filter shows a different result.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro does not show Σ Original Estimate, Σ Remaining Estimate when there are no subtasks

fields.description: When setting the logout.url in the seraph-config.xml, then the user is redirected properly to the url, however is not not logged out of confluence.
fields.summary: SSO Logout does not logout user

Do we even test against an SSO solution?

BTW should there be another component added to JAC for this macro?

Leaving page title blank when using Doc Import can break all internal hyperlinks in the space

fields.description:
Issue also filed [here|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/DOC-54]

I haven't experienced the problem myself but this [Twitter user|http://twitter.com/macwhiz/status/12612249289] encountered it and Charles confirmed the problem on his iPad.
fields.summary: Scrolling within Documentation Theme is broken for iPad

fields.description:
In Firefox 3.6 on Windows XP, when the expand macro is utilized, the a (link) styles apply to all elements in the expanded area and in the subsequent contents on a page. This starts with the actual text that is set in the expand macro as the "title" of the expandable section - which acts like a link in the browser.


http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Expand+Text+User+Macro 


I've attached two screen shots with a custom CSS applied (which shows the problem more clearly, via a color change). I have removed and tested each link style individually to determine if it is in fact the CSS that is causing the problem but it is not.


This problem does not occur in the same manner in Chrome or IE7 on Windows XP. In those cases, only list items seem to inherit the style of the expandable link. This happens with list content no matter where it appears in the expandable section.
fields.summary: Display Issue with Expand Macro

fields.description: The accents (French) are not displayed correctly in the preview mode (notes that the TOC macro is displayed them without error).
fields.summary: Unable to have accent in preview mode
Implement a Federated Search

fields.description:
h3. Original Description

We've recently decided to clean up our permission scheme a bit, and part of this involved using nested groups. We already used Crowd to link our Confluence instance (as well as JIRA and some third-party things) to our Active Directory server, and Crowd supports nested groups so we didn't think there would be any problem.

Since then however, it happens regularly that users can't access a certain space in Confluence to which they should have access through nested groups. For example, there would be a space called "Human Resources", to which a group called "confluence-hr" has full access. Then there would be a group "Management" that is a member of the "confluence-hr" group amongst others, and obviously the management people are members of this group. The goal is to be able to add people to just one or two "role" groups like "Management" by which they get all the permissions they need, while also being able to keep fine-grained control, so that if someone needs just access to the HR space, we add them to the confluence-hr group and they don't get access to everything else like Management.

The only fix I've been able to find is restarting the Confluence instance. After a restart, everything works fine again, but a bit later the same problem arises. This happens sometimes several times a day, and it's very irritating. Can anyone suggest a proper fix for this, or is this a genuine bug?

h3. Updated Description 
This is caused by CWD-1996. 

h3. Workaround 
We have still not been able to find the source of the problem within the confluence code, however we do know that someone the confluence caches are affecting the crowd caches. 

We have attached the [crowd-integration-client-2.0.7-CWD-1996.jar|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/40829/crowd-integration-client-2.0.7-CWD-1996.jar] which shades net.sf.ehcache to com.atlassian.crowd.shaded.ehcache. What this means is that there is no possible way that Confluence could have any effect whatsoever with the Crowd integration client's caches. They are essentially different classes that Confluence knows nothing about.

To apply the patch, upgrade to crowd 2.0.7 and in your confluence instance, remove the any other Crowd integration client JARs from
{{CONFLUENCE_INSTALL}}/confluence/WEB-INF/lib
and place the attached [crowd-integration-client-2.0.7-CWD-1996.jar|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/40829/crowd-integration-client-2.0.7-CWD-1996.jar] and restart confluence. 

This integration is being completely rewritten for Crowd 2.1 / Confluence 3.5, which will fix this bug permantently.
fields.summary: Crowd+Confluence nested groups fail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19430].
  {panel}

It would be nice if PDF Export has an option to easily generate numbered page title according to TOC generated by the PDF Export. The table below shows the current and desired PDF Export behaviour:

h5. Current PDF Export Behaviour
|| Table of Content || Page Title in the PDF Export ||
| 1. Parent Page Title | Parent Page Title |
| 1.1 Child Page Title | Child Page Title |
| 1.1.1 Grand Child Page Title | Grand Child Page Title |
| 2. Parent Page Title | Parent Page Title |
| 2.1 Child Page Title | Child Page Title |  

\\
h5. Desired PDF Export Behaviour
|| Table of Content || Page Title in the PDF Export ||
| 1. Parent Page Title | 1. Parent Page Title |
| 1.1 Child Page Title | 1.1 Child Page Title |
| 1.1.1 Grand Child Page Title | 1.1.1 Grand Child Page Title |
| 2. Parent Page Title | 2. Parent Page Title |
| 2.1 Child Page Title | 2.1 Child Page Title |
fields.summary: Option to easily generate numbered page title according to TOC in PDF Export

fields.description:
In IE7 on Windows XP, there is a minor display issue when editing a page with Wiki Markup as the default view. When you edit a page, the top line of text in the edit area is cut off by the link/macro/image bar (see screen cap). It also cuts off the top arrow in the scroll bar for the edit area.

If you switch views to rich text and back to Wiki Markup, the edit area renders correctly.


It renders correctly in FF 3.6 on XP.
fields.summary: Display issue in Confluence Edit Page/Wiki Markup view in IE7
Change "Dashboard" text on dashboard space and in breadcrumbs

fields.description:
When trying out the new autocomplete functionality in the rich text editor we found out that
* inserting attachments / images works as described (using ! and waiting for a while)
* inserting links (using [ and waiting for a while) only seems to work on a querty keyboard

All of our users have an *azerty* keyboard, on which you need to press *Alt Gr* simultaneously with another button to insert a [ character. 
For a moment you can see the autocomplete getting to live but not for long :). I suppose the *Alt Gr* is the root of the problem here...
fields.summary: link autocomplete only working on a querty keyboard layout?
Problem with editing an Office Spreadsheet

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms:
Any operation that relies on Quartz scheduling fail to start. eg. automatic indexing, mail queue flush, etc.

We have not gotten to the root cause of the issue yet, but I have created this issue so we can track the number of people affected by this and have one area to put down the set of instructions. 

h4. Workaround

The issue appears to be related to the quartz library we include with confluence. This was upgrade to 1.6.1 in Confluence 3.2. Please try the latest version of quartz where we believe the issue is resolved. To do so:

1) Shutdown confluence 
2) Make a backup of your {{<CONFLUENCE_INSTALL>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/quartz-1.6.1.jar}}
3) Delete your {{<CONFLUENCE_INSTALL>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/quartz-1.6.1.jar}} and copy into your {{<CONFLUENCE_INSTALL>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}} the attached [quartz-1.8.0.jar|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/38060/quartz-1.8.0.jar].
4) Restart confluence 

Wait to see if the problem can be reproduced. If it can, please raise an issue in [http://support.atlassian.com] (or comment in your existing one).
fields.summary: Confluence automatic indexing fails

fields.description: Since Confluence 2.3, the main Confluence acceptance tests have used RPC to log the start of each test on the server.  This is often useful for determining how a server error may have affected a test.  Our Selenium and REST tests do not have this logging, since it's currently done by AbstractConfluenceAcceptanceTest.  It's really time that we moved it out of ACAT and into the test-support package where it can be easily used by any test class.
fields.summary: Enable test-start server logging in REST/Selenium tests

fields.description:
Restoring XML backup created by confluence 3.2 fails with error:
bq. Import failed. com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Error performing import: Error processing backup. Refer to logs for more details.

In the following error can be observed from the log file:
{code}
2010-04-23 13:58:17,406 ERROR [Importing data task] [confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter] importEntities Cannot import the entities:
 -- referer: http://localhost/confluence/admin/backup.action | url: /confluence/admin/restore.action | userName: admin | action: restore
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Error performing import: Error processing backup. Refer to logs for more details.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.legacy.LegacyXmlImporter.doImport(LegacyXmlImporter.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEntities(BackupImporter.java:314)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEverything(BackupImporter.java:275)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.FileBackupImporter.importEverything(FileBackupImporter.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.doImport(BackupImporter.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.FileBackupImporter.doImport(FileBackupImporter.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultImportExportManager.importAs(DefaultImportExportManager.java:74)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy76.importAs(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask.runInternal(ImportLongRunningTask.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:21)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: Error processing backup. Refer to logs for more details.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.legacy.ReverseDatabinder.fromXML(ReverseDatabinder.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.legacy.LegacyXmlImporter.doImport(LegacyXmlImporter.java:38)
	... 20 more
Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.ImageDetailsDto.<init>()
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.legacy.ReverseDatabinder.endElement(ReverseDatabinder.java:280)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanEndElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl.parse(Unknown Source)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.legacy.ReverseDatabinder.fromXML(ReverseDatabinder.java:115)
	... 21 more
Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.ImageDetailsDto.<init>()
	at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Class.getConstructor(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.legacy.ImportedObject.readObjectId(ImportedObject.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.legacy.ReverseDatabinder.endElement(ReverseDatabinder.java:214)
{code}

If you search through entities.xml of your backup you can find :
bq. <object class="ImageDetailsDto" package="com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments">

h4. Patch for 3.2 

I have attached patches for Confluence 3.2 to resolve this issue.

# Download the patch [here|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/38018/conf-19422-3.2.zip].
# Shutdown Confluence.
# Follow the documentation to [install this patch|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Patched+Class+Files].
# Startup Confluence.

*If you are running Confluence 3.2.1 you do not need to install this patch, 3.2.1 includes this fix.*
fields.summary: Error when restoring version 3.2 XML backup

fields.description: The Macro Browser title should be "Insert 'x' Macro", not "Edit 'x' Macro" when inserting a macro.
fields.summary: When inserting a macro from the RTE Insert menu, the macro browser title says Edit not Insert

fields.description:
The macro icons for the editor autocomplete dropdown come from a 20px-high sprite, but plugin macro icons won't be in the sprite.

The plugin macro icon shows in the Macro Browser as an image so we should be able to scale the image down and add it to the dropdown item in the same way that we do for Image Autocomplete dropdown items.
fields.summary: Editor Autocomplete shows incorrect macro icon for plugins

fields.description: The small macro icons look correct in IE 7 & 8 but not in IE6. The usual alpha fix should be applied.
fields.summary: Editor Autocomplete for Macros needs transparent icons fixing in IE6

fields.description: After https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/changelog/confluence/?cs=113072, the conditional comments caused javascript errors in IE (all versions).
fields.summary: Confluence completely broken in IE

fields.description:
It seems as though one of the code changes in 3.2.1 has caused broken images on CAC.

{noformat}!Groups.png|border=1;bordercolor=gray! {noformat}

See problem report from edawson:

{quote}I've had a few reports recently of broken screenshots in our CAC documentation: a red error message appears in place of previously functional screenshots saying the following:

"Size parameter must be a number (optionally followed by 'px', 'pt' or 'em')."

This occurs even if you aren't specifying a size parameter. You can see what the errror looks like here, and see the Wiki markup code that generates it.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=216957093

I fixed this particular instance of the problem by replacing a semi-colon with a comma in the screenshot properties:

 "border=1;bordercolor=gray".

I suspect that this might be related to a recent Confluence code change as most of this content has been static (and functioning quite well) for some time. I have instances of the error in the JIRA Studio documentation (pages that haven't recently been edited) as well as FishEye space. It might be worth searching for usage of the image macro where semicolons are used instead of commas, and doing a general browse around for it for broken images.{quote}
fields.summary: Semi-colon separator used to work for image properties, but doesn't in 3.2.1 which causes broken images on CAC

fields.description:
It should be as easy to insert a macro as to insert a link.

For starters, typing '{' in the RTE should open a "macro mode" where the user can search for a macro as if they had opened the Macro Browser and gone to the search field. Selecting a result would open the form for that macro in the Macro Browser.

The default suggestion results should list the current "featured" macros as per the Insert Menu, and both the suggestion and search results should include a general link to the Macro Browser at the bottom
fields.summary: Editor Autocomplete : Implement for Macros

fields.description:
•We recently upgraded from 2.8.1 to 3.2. While in Edit with the Rich Text Editor, he user was able to drag and drop an image in a page to another location in the same page. With 3.2 he clicks on the image. It is selected with a border around it, but it can't be moved. He clicks again, this time there is no border around the image, but there is a move icon. He can drag the icon to the location he wants, but when he drops it into the location, nothing happens. 

To recreate this issue: Insert an image on a page. Create other information on the page. Try to drag and drop the image to another location on the page. Try it twice. The first time the border appears around the item; the second time the drag and drop icon appears, but the image doesn't move either time.
fields.summary: After 3.2 upgrade, cannot drag and drop an image from location to another on the same page
JIRA Issues Macro seems to ignore column:width paramenters

fields.description:
I'm using Confluence at Skype (confluence.skype.net)

steps to replicate:
1) login to confluence.skype.net
2) create a new page under any space
3) edit page, save
4) goto your own profile (e.g., /users/viewmyprofile.action)
5) bug: most recent page created not listed in "Activity" feed
fields.summary: Activity feed does not include recent activity

fields.description:
I'm using Confluence at Skype (confluence.skype.net) and am not getting expected search results when searching for pages.

Steps to replicate:
1) login to confluence.skype.net
2) create a page in any space
3) fill in a unique title and some body content, save page
4) try to search for page you just created by title
5) bug: new page will not be in results

additional replication:
6) try creating another page 
7) click the "chain link" icon to add a link
8) try to link to the page created in #3, above, by searching for it
9) bug: unable to find page, unable to link
fields.summary: Search results don't contain expected results

fields.description:
Attaching a File with German Umlauts (e.g. ü, ä or ö) or French accented letters (é, â, ç, etc) in its filename breaks the edit and remove actions on that attachment.

We have two confluence instances, one is confluence-3.2 with MS SQL server, the other one is confluence-3.1 with MySQL. Both run on tomcat 6.0.18 on 32bit debian. It happens on both instances; we pass the encoding test (admin/encodingtest.action) on both confluence instances. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Attach a file with filename e.g. "test_ä_test.png" to a page
* Try to edit or remove the file 

h3. Actual results
* The file cannot be edited or removed; NullPointerException at at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.MoveAttachmentAction.bootstrap(MoveAttachmentAction.java:115); Stacktrace is attached
* Viewing the file works

h3. Expected results

Editing or removing those attachments can be done without fiddling around with the URL

h3. Workaround

The link to editattachment.action and removeattachment.action contains the URL escaped filename:
http://CONFLUENCE_HOST/confluence/pages/editattachment.action?pageId=3997707&fileName=test_%C3%A4_test.png
http://CONFLUENCE_HOST/confluence/pages/removeattachment.action?pageId=3997707&fileName=test_%C3%A4_test.png&version=1

If you call the URL without escaping the umlaut like this:
http://CONFLUENCE_HOST/confluence/pages/editattachment.action?pageId=3997707&fileName=test_ä_test.png
http://CONFLUENCE_HOST/confluence/pages/removeattachment.action?pageId=3997707&fileName=test_ä_test.png&version=1
the attachment can be edited or removed.


Thank you for your help,
Ferdinand
fields.summary: Accessing edit/remove attachment URL containing a filename with German Umlauts throws NullPointerException
Public-key encryption of backups

fields.description: Several JSPs found under the admin section of Confluence have been found to be vulnerable to XSS attacks. This issue corrects those problems. This issue is rated HIGH. Please refer to http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for information on other security related issues and more information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in some JSPs under admin section

fields.description: A XSS vulnerability has been found in the Advanced Macros plugin. This issue corrects that problem. This issue is rated HIGH. Please refer to http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for information on other security related issues and more information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in Advanced Macros plugin

fields.description: The XML encoder only encodes strings. This  could make Confluence return non encoded content. This issue is rated HIGH. Please see http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for more security related issue and more information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: Only strings are encoded

fields.description: The BootstrapManager exposed in layout templates should be read only. This issue changes the behavior of the BootstrapManager so it is now read only. This issue is rated HIGH. Please see http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for other security related issues and information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: BootstrapManager exposed in layout templates should be read only

fields.description: Clicking 'Edit in Office' for PowerPoint files has no action when using Office XP and IE. Have been able to replicate with both IE 7 and IE 8. Using Office 2003+ or Firefox/Safari allows editing.
fields.summary: Edit in Office is unresponsive for PowerPoint documents using Office XP and IE

fields.description: The SOAP and XML-RPC APIs return more information than is needed. This issue corrects that problem. This issue is rated HIGH. Please see http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for more security related issues and information on how we rate our issues.
fields.summary: SOAP and XML-RPC APIs return too much information

fields.description: It is possible to set the daily backup path and (partial) name through the web UI. This could mean that information can be obtained by a rouge admin. This issue addresses that by introducing a flag so concerned administrators can remove this feature. This flag is set to false by default meaning it is not possible to edit the path through the admin ui. The flag admin.ui.allow.daily.backup.custom.location in  confluence.cfg.xml can be set to true to enable easy configuring of the path. This issue is rated MODERATE. Please refer to http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for more information on other security related issues and how we rate issues.
fields.summary: Path for daily backup is configurable through WEB UI

fields.description: Require user to answer CAPTCHA after three failed attempts. For SOAP and XMLRPC this means that the user will have to open a browser to answer the CAPTCHA, similar to how google does it. This issue has been rated MODERATE. Please refer to http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for details on other security warnings and more information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: Require user to answer CAPTCHA after three failed attempts

fields.description: Confluence exposes a list of the administrators. This issue corrects this by removing the list and providing the user with a form that can be used to send e-mail to all the relevant administrators on the user's behalf.
fields.summary: The list of Confluence administrators is accessible via a URL

fields.description: Currently Confluence allows easy download of XML site backups. This could be considered a security risk. This issue introduces a flag in the Confluence_cfg.xml that allows system administrators to turn this feature on or off. By default it is off meaning that the link will not be displayed. The flag admin.ui.allow.manual.backup.download can be changed to true to enable the link again. A restart of Confluence is needed after this flag has changed. The severity of this issue is rated HIGH. Please refer to http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for other security related issues and information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: Remove the download link for XML site backups

fields.description:
The SupportUtility allows the user to enter an arbitrary e-mail address to send a copy of the e-mail to.
This issue removes the option for users to enter an e-mail address to CC. 

This issue also introduces a flag that prevents the TO address from being changed through the web interface. By default this flag is false. The flag can be changed in the confluence_cfg.xml once Confluence has been setup. The flag to change is admin.ui.allow.site.support.email a restart of Confluence is needed to change this flag.

This issue is rated HIGH. Please refer to http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for other security related issues and information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: Mail support request accepts any e-mail address

fields.description: Files included in the generated zip file could contain private information. This issue addresses that by removing all sensitive information before creating the zip. The severity of this issue is HIGH. Please see http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for other security related issues and information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: Anonymise config files in support zip

fields.description: A XSS vulnerability where a string could bypass the Anti-XSS mechanism has been identified. This issue corrects this problem. The severity of this issue is rated as LOW. Please see http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZILmD for information on other security related issues and our rating system.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19387].
  {panel}

A Space Admin, who is not a full confluence Admin, attempted to goto http://wiki.customink.office/confluence/spaces/viewstylesheet.action?key=PA
but then got the error:

Not Permitted
You are not permitted to perform this operation.

As the Stylesheet should only impact the Space he was an Admin of, I expected him to be able to perform this action.  Workaround is to either make him a Confluence Admin, which breaks "Least Privilege" security goal, or for a full admin to make the changes this Space Admin desires.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19383].
  {panel}

Here are the suggestions: 

- rename to "preview-iframe-onload"
- reference to iframe object in rendered-content.vm can be obtained using document.frameElement
- AJS.MacroBrowser.previewOnload() and AJS.Editor.previewFrameOnload() updated to use the iframe
- AJS.Editor.disableFrame() update to use the iframe reference 
- The iframe's document can be obtained by in a cross-browser safe way using jQuery(iframeElem).contents().
fields.summary: Make "render-content-loaded" event expose an iframe to the event handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19375].
  {panel}

A user was unable to create a bookmark in Confluence using the bookmarklet in Firefox on [Mac] Snow Leopard.  When the user clicked "Bookmark in Confluence", the "Add Bookmark" screen that appeared lacked any [Confluence] Space options in the Space dropdown list.  Additionally, the "Save" and "Cancel" buttons are not visible.

I was able to reproduce the empty Space dropdown by attempting to add a bookmark using the bookmarklet while not logged into Confluence using Firefox 3.6 on Windows Vista.  I was able to see the "Save" and "Cancel" buttons, and received the following error message after successfully passing the CAPTCHA:

"The following errors need to be fixed before the bookmark can be saved

    * Please select a space for the bookmark.
    * You must enter a spaceKey."

h1. Workaround
The user has confirmed that if they are logged into Confluence _*prior*_ to attempting to add a bookmark to Confluence - the Space dropdown is populated and the buttons are visible.

h1. Suggestion
It would be nice if the page provided information to indicate that the user has to be logged into Confluence in order to add a bookmark to it.  Looks like that indication can be keyed off the Space list being empty.
fields.summary: Bookmarklet: Provide Information when Spaces Dropdown is not populated

fields.description:
Resolving CONF-19321 has a few documentation implications.

The general fix is that instead of adminstrators.action returning a list of e-mail addresses for the configured administrators of the site it will now give you a form which you can use to e-mail all the administrators of the site. This is preferable since it doesn't give the user any information about who these administrators are (e.g. the old mechanism of supplying their e-mail addresses could make it easier to guess the usernames of administrators for the site).

This mechanism is linked from the 500 error page in Confluence. It is also linked in 3.3 onwards from the template and theme configuration pages for a space.

*Conditions to watch out for:*
1) If there is no mail server configured for the site then instead of a contact form you will receive a message telling you that - "No mail server has been configured so it is not possible to contact the site administrators via this method."
2) If none of the administrators for the site have e-mail addresses you also get a message instead of the form - "None of the site administrators have e-mail addresses set so cannot be contacted via this method."
3) If you have removed the confluence-administrators group then you receive the same message as in point 2. (I know this isn't quite correct but you could argue it avoids giving out specific details the user set up of the instance. There wasn't enough time to add handling for this specific condition.)
4) If SPAM prevention/Captcha is configured then those configuration settings will also apply to this form

*Configuration Options*
1) As mentioned previously, the site wide SPAM prevention settings are used here.
2) There is a new General Configuration setting called "Custom Contact Administrator Message:". This allows you to change the prompt that is presented before the form.
3) There is a new General Configuration setting called "Contact Administrators Form". This allows you to turn the form off. This should be used in conjunction with the previous setting explaining your alternative contact mechanism.

I've attached a few screenshots to help illustrate things.

If you would prefer me to write (or provide a first draft of) the documentation please just get back to me with a location for where it should live and I'll do it immediately.
fields.summary: Documentation for the new 'contact administrators' function in Confluence

fields.description:

{code}
2010-04-19 16:19:52,298 ERROR [http-8320-6] [confluence.servlet.download.ExportDownload] getS
treamForDownload com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.resource.UnauthorizedDownloadResourceE
xception
 -- referer: http://localhost:8320/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=491522 | url: /download/temp/
pdfexport-20100419-19Apr10-0419PM-1/admin-H%EBllo-19Apr10-0419PM-2.pdf | userName: admin
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.resource.UnauthorizedDownloadResourceException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.resource.ExportDownloadResourceManager.getRe
sourceReader(ExportDownloadResourceManager.java:67)
{code}

fields.summary: PDF exports fail for pages with umlauts in their title

fields.description:
When using an own Plugin from an IE8, I got an error in the formToArry() function of the jquery libraries in the batch.js (see below). It works on IE6 and Firefox.

####################################################################################
Benutzer-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.0;
Trident/4.0; SLCC1; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; Media Center PC 5.0; .NET CLR
3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30618)
Zeitstempel: Mon, 19 Apr 2010 06:50:09 UTC

Meldung: Objekt erforderlich
Zeile: 852
Zeichen: 17
Code: 0
URI:
https://www.ctwiki.siemens.com/confluence/s/1725/9/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js
####################################################################################

I debugged the js code and detected the incorrect statement (see below). It is the part, which serializes a SELECT element. The op.attributes['value'] returns null and so the op.attributes['value'].specified leads to the error mentioned before.


####################################################################################
 var v = $.browser.msie && !(op.attributes['value'].specified) ? op.text : op.value;
####################################################################################
fields.summary: Error in js function formToArray() in IE8

Please see attached files. 

Please note that the panel macro has similar difficulties when it exactly fills a page see Test_Panel.pdf attachment
